## R Markdown

This is an R Markdown document. Markdown is a simple formatting syntax for authoring HTML, PDF, and MS Word documents. For more details on using R Markdown see <http://rmarkdown.rstudio.com>.

When you click the **Knit** button a document will be generated that includes both content as well as the output of any embedded R code chunks within the document. You can embed an R code chunk like this:

```{r cars}
library(tidyverse)
library(xlsx)
```

## Including Plots

You can also embed plots, for example:

```{r pressure, echo=FALSE}



DDT_12040320_100 <- read.xlsx("./Pre-emptive/DDT - 12040320.xlsx", 1, header = TRUE)
```

##Pre-emptive: DDT with random seed nodes, n = 100
```{r}
DDT_Random_100 <- read.xlsx("./Pre-emptive/DDT.xlsx",1, header=TRUE)
ggplot(data = DDT_Random_100, aes(x = Percentage, y = AverageSize, color=Strategy, group=Strategy)) + 
  geom_point() +
  geom_line() +
  scale_x_continuous(breaks = seq(0, 2, 0.4)) +
  xlab("Vaccination Coverage (%)") +
  ylab("Average Outbreak Size") +
  labs(title = "DDT Pre-emptive (n = 100)", subtitle = "Seed node ID = Random") +
  theme(
    plot.title = element_text(size = 14, face = "bold"),
    plot.subtitle = element_text(size = 12),
    axis.title = element_text(size = 12, face = "bold")
  )
```
